title: 109_hr827
content: The Act may be cited as the "Screening Abdominal Aortic Aneurysms Very Efficiently (SAAAVE) Act of 2005" and includes Medicare coverage for ultrasound screening for abdominal aortic aneurysms. The "Screening Abdominal Aortic Aneurysms Very Efficiently (SAAAVE) Act of 2005" amends the Social Security Act to include Medicare coverage for ultrasound screening for abdominal aortic aneurysm for individuals with specific risk factors. The SAAAVE Act of 2005 amends the Social Security Act to include Medicare coverage for ultrasound screening for abdominal aortic aneurysm for individuals with specific risk factors, such as evidences of arthrosclerotic vascular disease or other specified risk factors as determined by the Secretary. "Ultrasound screening for abdominal aortic aneurysm is covered by Medicare for individuals with specific risk factors." Medicare covers ultrasound screening for abdominal aortic aneurysm for individuals with specific risk factors. The screening involves using sound waves for early detection and includes a physician's interpretation of the results. Payment for ultrasound screening for abdominal aortic aneurysm under Medicare is amended to include frequency and quality standards. This involves inserting new subparagraphs and ensuring screenings are not performed too frequently or by individuals/laboratories that do not meet quality standards. Payment for ultrasound screening for abdominal aortic aneurysm under Medicare is amended to include quality assurance standards for diagnostic laboratories and individuals performing the screenings. Certification by appropriate State licensing agencies or national certification organizations recognized by the Secretary is required. The amendment also exempts these screenings from the Part B deductible. The Secretary will consult with medical societies to establish risk factors and quality assurance standards for ultrasound screenings for abdominal aortic aneurysm. The amendments apply to screenings performed on or after January 1, 2006. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will conduct a national education campaign to raise awareness about the importance of early detection and treatment of abdominal aortic aneurysms. Funds may be used to provide grants to medical societies for educating practitioners. Appropriations are authorized for fiscal year 2006 and beyond.
